intro: Centropogon occultus f. denudatus, commonly known as the naked centropogon, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its reduced foliage, giving it the "naked" appearance in its foliage form. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a critically endangered species.
